meanings.definition: A person who improvises, especially in music or theater.
meanings.sent1: The talented improvisor impressed the audience with his spontaneous acting.
meanings.sent2: The improvisor on stage made up funny scenes on the spot.
meanings.sent3: The improvisor forgot his lines but turned it into a hilarious moment.
meanings.sent4: She was like an improvisor of life, always ready for whatever came her way.
meanings.sent5: The improvisor's ability to think on their feet amazed everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: One who performs without preparation or planning.
meanings.sent1: As an improvisor, she never knew what role she would play next.
meanings.sent2: The talented improvisor could create magic on stage without any script.
meanings.sent3: The improvisor showed up to the play without knowing the plot, but still delivered a great performance.
meanings.sent4: He was an improvisor in the kitchen, creating delicious dishes from whatever ingredients he had.
meanings.sent5: The improvisor's ability to adapt to any situation made them a valuable asset to the team.
